Package com.jummania

Class DataManagerImpl

java.lang.Object
com.jummania.DataManagerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataManager
public class DataManagerImpl extends Object implements DataManager
Implementation of the DataManager interface.

This class provides concrete methods for storing, retrieving, and managing data. It utilizes Gson for serializing and deserializing objects to and from JSON format and stores the data in a specified directory.

The class ensures thread-safety and proper directory management for storing the data.

Created by Jummania on 20, November, 2024. Email: sharifuddinjumman@gmail.com Dhaka, Bangladesh.

      public DataManagerImpl(File filesDir, DataManager.Converter converter)
      Constructor for initializing the DataManagerImpl. Ensures that the specified directory exists or is created.
      Parameters:
      filesDir - The directory where data is stored.
      converter - The converter for serialization/deserialization.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided filesDir or converter is null.

  • Method Details

    • getString

      public String getString(String key, String defValue)
      Retrieves a `String` from stored data using the specified key. This method delegates the retrieval task to `getObject`, passing `String.class` to deserialize the stored JSON data into a `String` object. If an error occurs during retrieval or deserialization, it logs the error and returns the default value.
      Specified by:
      getString in interface DataManager
      Parameters:
      key - The key used to identify the stored data.
      defValue - The default value to return if the data is not found or an error occurs.
      Returns:
      The retrieved `String` value, or the default value if an error occurs.

    • getObject

      public <T> T getObject(String key, Type type)
      Retrieves an object of the specified type from the stored data using the given key. This method reads the stored data as a JSON file, deserializes it into the specified type using Gson, and returns the object. If the key or type is invalid, or if an error occurs during deserialization, it returns null.
      Specified by:
      getObject in interface DataManager
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the object to return.
      Parameters:
      key - The key used to identify the stored data.
      type - The Type object representing the desired type of the object to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The object of type T, or null if the data does not exist, deserialization fails, or an error occurs.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided key or type is null.

    • getParameterized

      public <T> T getParameterized(String key, Type rawType, Type... typeArguments)
      Retrieves a parameterized object associated with the given key from the stored data. This method allows deserialization of complex types with generic type parameters. The generic type arguments are passed in as varargs, enabling support for parameterized types like lists or maps.
      Specified by:
      getParameterized in interface DataManager
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the object to be returned.
      Parameters:
      key - The key used to identify the stored parameterized object.
      rawType - The raw type of the object to be retrieved (e.g., `List.class`, `Map.class`).
      typeArguments - The type arguments (e.g., `String.class`, `Integer.class`) to specify the specific types for generics.
      Returns:
      The deserialized object of type `T`, or `null` if the object could not be retrieved.

    • getList

      public <T> List<T> getList(String key, Type type)
      Retrieves a list of objects associated with the given key from the stored data. This method supports paginated or batched data retrieval, where data is stored in multiple parts (e.g., "key.0", "key.1", ...) and will continue retrieving batches until no more data is found.
      Specified by:
      getList in interface DataManager
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of objects contained in the list.
      Parameters:
      key - The key used to identify the list of objects in the stored data.
      type - The type of individual objects in the list (e.g., `String.class`, `Book.class`).
      Returns:
      A list of deserialized objects of type `T`. If no data is found, an empty list is returned.

    • fromJson

      public <T> T fromJson(String value, Type type)
      Converts the provided JSON string to an object of the specified type.

      This method uses Gson to deserialize the JSON string into an object of the specified type. The type parameter allows the conversion to a specific object type, including generic types.

      Specified by:
      fromJson in interface DataManager
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object.
      Parameters:
      value - the JSON string to deserialize.
      type - the type of the object to deserialize into.
      Returns:
      the deserialized object of type T.
      Throws:
      com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException - if the JSON string is not a valid representation for the specified type.

    • fromReader

      public <T> T fromReader(Reader json, Type typeOfT)

      Type Parameters:

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • toJson

      public String toJson(Object object)
      Converts the given object to a JSON string.

      This method uses Gson to serialize an object into its JSON representation. It can handle any object type and converts it into a JSON string.

      Specified by:
      toJson in interface DataManager
      Parameters:
      object - the object to serialize into JSON.
      Returns:
      the JSON string representation of the object.
      Throws:
      com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException - if the object cannot be serialized into JSON.

    • contains

      public boolean contains(String key)
      Checks if a file associated with the given key exists in the stored data. This method determines whether a file corresponding to the provided key is present in the data storage directory.
      Specified by:
      contains in interface DataManager
      Parameters:
      key - The key used to identify the file in the stored data.
      Returns:
      `true` if the file exists, `false` otherwise.

      Registers a listener to be notified when data changes. This method allows you to register a listener that will be notified whenever the stored data is modified.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:
      listener - The listener that will be notified of data changes.

    • unregisterOnDataChangeListener

      public void unregisterOnDataChangeListener()
      Unregisters the currently registered data change listener. This method removes the previously registered listener, preventing it from being notified of any future data changes.
      Specified by:
      unregisterOnDataChangeListener in interface DataManager

    • saveString

      public void saveString(String key, String value)
      Stores a String value in the storage associated with the provided key. This method serializes the String and stores it in a file corresponding to the key.
      Specified by:

      value - The String value to be stored. It cannot be null.

    • saveObject

      public void saveObject(String key, Object value)
      Saves an object as a JSON string in the storage associated with the provided key. This method serializes the given object into JSON format and stores it in a file corresponding to the key. If the key already exists, the method will overwrite the existing file.
      Specified by:
      saveObject in interface DataManager
      Parameters:
      key - The key used to identify the stored object.
      value - The object to be serialized and stored. It cannot be null.

    • saveList

      public <T> void saveList(String key, List<T> value)
      Stores a list of objects in the storage associated with the provided key. This method divides the list into smaller batches and stores each batch separately. The default batch size is 999, but you can specify a different size with the second method.
      Specified by:
      saveList in interface DataManager
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of objects in the list.
      Parameters:
      key - The key used to identify the stored list of objects.
      value - The list of objects to be stored.

    • saveList

      public <T> void saveList(String key, List<T> value, int maxArraySize)
      Stores a list of objects in the storage associated with the provided key. This method divides the list into smaller batches (based on maxArraySize) and stores each batch separately.
      Specified by:
      saveList in interface DataManager
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of objects in the list.
      Parameters:
      key - The key used to identify the stored list of objects.
      value - The list of objects to be stored.
      maxArraySize - The maximum size of each batch. If the list is larger than this, it will be split into multiple batches.

    • remove

      public void remove(String key)
      Removes all files associated with the given key. This method checks for multiple files associated with a key by appending an index (e.g., key.0, key.1, ...) and deletes them. Once no more indexed files are found, it removes the main file associated with the key.
      Specified by:
      remove in interface DataManager
      Parameters:
      key - The key whose associated files are to be deleted.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears all files in the directory (filesDir). This method iterates over all files in the directory and removes each one. If the directory is empty or does not exist, appropriate messages are logged.
      Specified by:
      clear in interface DataManager
